board of appeals shall grant or deny variations of the provisions of this ordinance in harmony with its general purpose and intent except the planning and zoning commission shall recommend and the board of trustees shall approve variations that are part of special uses b initiation an application for a variation may be made by any person firm or corporation or by any office department board or commission requesting or intending to request application for a zoning certificate c application and processing an application for a variation shall be filed with the zoning administrator with the required fee the zoning administrator shall forward such application to the zoning board of appeals for processing in accordance with the illinois revised statutes as amended  to the village staff for review and comment  and to the village clerk for filing the application shall contain such information as the zoning board of appeals may by rule require and shall include at a minimum 1 legal description and common address of subject property  2 current plat of survey locating lot lines and all existing structures  3 proof of ownership or disclosure of beneficial trust  4 existing zoning of property  and 5 proposed variation d hearing no variation shall be granted by the zoning board of appeals except after a public hearing before the zoning board of appeals for public hearing requirements see section 1313 e findings of fact within sixty 60 days of the public hearing the zoning board of appeals shall grant or deny any petition for variation every variation which is granted by the zoning board of appeals shall be accompanied by findings of fact and shall refer to any exhibits containing plans and specifications for the proposed variation which shall remain a part of the permanent records of the zoning board of appeals the findings of fact shall specify the reason or reasons for granting or denying the variation 1 standards for variations a the zoning board of appeals shall not vary the provisions of this ordinance as authorized in this section unless it shall have made findings of fact based upon the evidence presented to it in the following specific cases 1 that the property in question cannot yield a reasonable return if permitted to be used only under the conditions allowed by the regulations governing the district in which it is located  2 that the plight of the owner is due to unique circumstances  or 3 that the variation if granted will not alter the essential character of the locality b for the purpose of supplementing the above standards the zoning board of appeals shall also take into consideration the extent to which the following facts favorable to the applicant have been established by the evidence 1 that the particular physical surroundings shape or topographical conditions of the specific property involved would bring a particular hardship upon the owner as distinguished from a mere inconvenience if the strict letter of the regulation were to be carried out  2 that the conditions upon which the petition for variation are based would not be applicable generally to other property within the same zoning classification  3 that the purpose of the variation is not based exclusively upon a desire to make more money out of the property  4 that the alleged difficulty or hardship has not been created by any person presently having an interest in the property  5 that the granting of the variation will not be detrimental to the public welfare or injurious to other property or improvements in the neighborhood in which the property is located  and 6 that the proposed variation will not impair an adequate supply of light and air to adjacent property or substantially increase the danger of fire or otherwise endanger the public safety or substantially diminish or impair property values within the neighborhood c the zoning board of appeals may require such conditions and restrictions upon the premises benefited by a variation as may be necessary to comply with the standards set forth in this section to reduce or minimize the injurious effect of such variation upon other property in the neighborhood and to implement the general purpose and intent of this ordinance 2 guidelines for variations variations from the regulations of this ordinance may be decided by the zoning board of appeals in accordance with the standards set forth in this section a to permit up to a twenty 20 percent reduction in the front side or rear yard required by this ordinance  b to permit the use of a lot or lots for a use otherwise prohibited solely because of insufficient area or width of the lot or lots but in no event shall the respective area and width of the lot be less than eighty 80 percent of the required area and width  c to permit the same offstreet parking spaces to qualify as required spaces for two 2 or more uses provided that the maximum use of such facility by each user does not take place during the same hours of the day or on the same days of the week  d to reduce the applicable offstreet parking or loading facilities required by not more than one parking space or loading space or twenty 20 percent of the applicable regulations whichever number is greater  e to increase by not more than twentyfive 25 percent the maximum distance that required parking spaces are permitted to be located from the use served  f to allow any use to exceed by no more than twenty 20 percent of the floor area ratio ground floor area and lot coverage imposed by the applicable regulations  g to allow any use to exceed the building height imposed by the applicable regulations by no more than twenty 20 percent but in no case shall the building height exceed five 5 stories  h to reduce the applicable landscape requirements by not more than twentyfive 25 percent of any quantitative requirement  i to extend the period of time a nonconforming use may continue or remain  j to exceed any of the authorized variations allowed under this section when a lot of record or a zoning lot vacant or legally used on the effective date of this ordinance is by reason of the exercise of the right of eminent domain by any authorized governmental body or by reason of a conveyance under threat of an eminent domain proceeding reduced in size so that the remainder of said lots does not conform with one or more of the regulations of the district in which said lot of record or zoning lot or structure is located  or k to exceed any of the authorized variations allowed under this section and only where the board of zoning appeals makes specific factual findings of exceptional site circumstances or conditions such variations shall require a favorable vote of twothirds  23  of the members of the zoning board of appeals then holding office f variation terms of relief the terms of relief granted shall be specifically set forth in a conclusion or statement separate from the findings of fact g zoning board of appeals action the zoning board of appeals may approve variations from the regulations of this ordinance in accordance with the provisions of sections 1309f1 and 1309f2 h status of variation granted every variation granted hereunder shall not be personal to the applicant therefore but shall be transferable and shall run with the land no variation granted by the zoning board of appeals shall be valid for a period of time longer than six 6 months from the date of such variation unless the building permit is obtained within such period and the erection or alteration of the building is started or the use is commenced within such period i decisions all administrative decisions and findings of the zoning board of appeals on variations arrived at after the hearing shall be final subject to judicial review only in accordance with the illinois revised statutes as amended  62287   71188   82288   91090   62491   92203 1310  amendments a authority for the purpose of promoting the public 62491   82216 1311  special uses a purpose the development and execution of the zoning ordinance is based upon the division of the village into districts within any one of which the use of land and buildings and structures as related to the land are essentially uniform it is recognized however that there are special uses which because of their unique character cannot be properly classified in any particular district or districts without consideration in each case of the impact of those uses upon neighboring lands and upon the public need for the particular use at the particular location such special uses fall into two 2 categories 1 uses operated by a public agency or publicly regulated utilities or uses traditionally affected with a public interest or 2 uses entirely private in character but of such a nature that the operation may give rise to unique problems with respect of their impact upon neighboring property or public facilities b authority special uses shall be authorized or denied by the president and board of trustees in accordance with the illinois revised statutes as amended and the regulations and conditions set forth in this ordinance for special uses no application for special use shall be acted upon by the village board of trustees until after review and public hearing before the planning and zoning commission and written reports of the findings of facts and recommendations of both boards have been submitted to the village board of trustees c initiation of special use special uses may be proposed by any person firm or corporation with a proprietary interest in the subject property requesting or intending to request a zoning certificate d application and processing for the procedures pertaining to special useplanned unit developments enforcement any person firm or corporation who violates disobeys omits neglects or refuses to comply with or who resists the enforcement of any of the provisions of this ordinance shall upon conviction be fined not less than thirtyfive dollars $3500 nor more than five hundred dollars $50000 for each offense the zoning administrator is hereby designated and authorized to enforce this ordinance in the event any building or structure is constructed reconstructed altered repaired converted or maintained or any building structure or land is used in violation of this ordinance the proper local authorities of the municipality or any owner or tenant of real property in the same contiguous zoning district as the building or structure in question in addition to other remedies may institute any appropriate action or proceeding 1 to prevent the unlawful construction reconstruction alteration repair conversion maintenance or use  2 to prevent the occupancy of the building structure or land  3 to prevent any illegal act conduct business or use in or about the premises  or 4 to restrain correct or abate the violation when any such action is instituted by an owner or tenant notice of such action shall be served upon the village of roselle at the time suit is begun by serving a copy of the complaint on the president of the village board no such action may be maintained until such notice has been given  71188 1316  adoption clause this ordinance was passed and approved on  by  71188 appendix b  subdivision regulations footnotes  1  editors note  adopted feb 26 199 enacted new subdivision regulations which are included herein as app b of said ordinance repealed former subdivision regulations which were contained in ch 19 the users attention is directed to the editors note at ch 19 and the table for a detailed analysis of inclusion of title this ordinance shall be known as the subdivision regulations of the village of roselle illinois purpose jurisdiction and interpretation purpose these regulations are adopted for the following purposes a to protect and provide for the public health safety and general welfare of the village of roselle b to guide the future growth and development of the village in accordance with the comprehensive plan c to provide for adequate light air and privacy to secure safety from fire flood and other danger and to prevent overcrowding of the land and undue congestion of population d to protect the character and the social and economic stability of all parts of the village and to encourage the orderly and beneficial development of all parts of the village e to protect and conserve the value of land throughout the village and the value of buildings and improvements upon the land and to minimize the conflicts among the uses of land and buildings f to guide public and private policy and action in order to provide adequate and efficient transportation water sewage schools parks playgrounds recreation and other public requirements and facilities g to provide the most beneficial relationship between the uses of land and buildings and the circulation of traffic throughout the village having particular regard to the avoidance of congestion in the streets and highways and the pedestrian traffic movements appropriate to the various uses of land and buildings and to provide for the proper location and width of streets and building lines h to establish reasonable standards of design and procedures for subdivision and resubdivisions in the orderly layout and use of land and to ensure proper legal descriptions and monumenting of subdivided land i to ensure that public facilities are available and will have a sufficient capacity to serve the proposed subdivision j to prevent the pollution of air streams and ponds  to assure the adequacy of drainage facilities  to safeguard the water table  and to encourage the wise use and management of natural resources throughout the village in order to preserve the integrity stability and beauty of the community and the value of land k to preserve the natural beauty and topography of the village and to ensure appropriate development with regard to these natural features l to provide for open spaces most efficient design and layout of the land including the use of average density in providing for minimum width and area of lots while preserving the density of land as established in the zoning ordinance of the village jurisdiction the subdivision ordinance of the village of roselle illinois shall apply to all subdivisions of land as defined herein located within the village of roselle or in part within the unincorporated area within one and onehalf 112 miles of the corporate limits of the village in accordance with of the illinois revised statutes the subdivision plans and plats including planned unit developments and proposed improvements to be installed and all procedures relating thereto shall in all respects be in full compliance with the regulations herein the planning and zoning commission of the village of roselle shall review divisions of land that are not defined herein as subdivisions according to the plats act to assure conformance with the area and bulk requirements of the zoning districts contained within the roselle zoning 03  interpretation a minimum standards established in their interpretation and application the provisions of this ordinance shall be held to be the minimum requirements for the promotion of the public health safety and general welfare b higher standards govern where the conditions imposed by any provisions of this ordinance upon the subdivision of land are either more restrictive or less restrictive than comparable conditions imposed by any other provisions of this ordinance or any other applicable law ordinance resolution rule or regulation of any kind the regulations which are more restrictive and impose higher standards or requirements shall govern under certain circumstances variations from standards and requirements contained in this ordinance may be granted by the board of trustees c easement or covenants not abrogated this ordinance is not intended to abrogate any easement covenant or any other private agreement provided that such private agreements do not conflict with federal law provided that where the regulations of this ordinance are more restrictive or impose higher standards or regulations that such easement covenant or other private agreement the requirement of this ordinance shall govern d existing subdivisions no subdivision of land which was not lawfully existing at the time of the adoption of this ordinance and to the extent that said subdivision of land is in conflict in any manner with the requirements of this ordinance remains unlawful hereunder rules and definitions rules the language set forth in the text of this ordinance shall be interpreted in accordance with the following rules of construction a the singular number includes the plural and the plural the singular  b the present tense includes the past and the future tenses and the future the present  c the subdivision of land shall hereafter be laid out within the incorporated limits of the village of roselle or within contiguous territory not more than one and one half 112 miles beyond the incorporated boundaries of the village of roselle the subdivider thereof or his agent shall submit both a preliminary plat and final subdivision plat to the village of roselle for its approval the subdivision plats and all procedures relating thereto shall in all respects be in full compliance with these regulations b until final plat for the subdivision is approved 1 no land shall be subdivided nor any street laid out nor any improvements made 2 no lot tract or parcel of land within any subdivision shall be sold 3 no improvements such as sidewalks water supply stormwater drainage sanitary sewage facilities gas service electric service lighting grading paving or surfacing of streets shall hereafter be made by any owner or owners or his or their agent c all offerings or dedications of land to the village or other governmental jurisdictions for use as streets highways alleys schools parks playgrounds or other public uses shall be referred to the planning and zoning commission and any other affected public agency other than the village for review and recommendation before being accepted by the board of trustees d the village engineering standards and specifications shall be the basis for all engineering determinations to be made pursuant to the provisions of these regulations e all sections of the roselle zoning regulate planned unit developments excluding those sections which pertain solely to zoning regulations are hereby incorporated into the roselle subdivision this section and are of full force and effect as though set out fully herein f the controlled release and storage of excess stormwater runoff shall be required in combination of all residential and nonresidential development in accordance with the village of roselle zoning general provisions vacation of a plat or subdivision a any plat or any part of a plat may be requested for vacation by the owner of the premises at any time before the sale of any lot therein by a written instrument to which a copy of such plat shall be attached declaring the same to be vacated b the procedure applicable to vacation of a plat of subdivision or any portion thereof shall be the same as set forth in these regulations for the subdivision of land dedication of park lands and school sites or for payments in lieu of dedication as a condition of approval of a final plat of subdivision a final plat of a planned unit development or upon issuance of building permits proposing any type of residential use each subdivider or developer will be required to dedicate land for park and recreational purposes and land for school sites to serve the immediate and future needs of the residents or the development or cash contribution in lieu of actual land dedication or a combination of both at the option of the corporate authorities of the village in accordance with the following criteria and formula a criteria for requiring park and recreation land dedication 1 requirements and population ratio the final estimated population of a proposed development shall bear directly upon the amount of land required for dedication the total requirement shall be five and fivetenths 55 acres of land per one thousand 1000 of final estimated population the required five and five tenths 55 acres may be allocated by the board of trustees in its discretion based upon the following criteria 2 location the roselle comprehensive plan shall be used as a guideline in locating sites a central location which will serve equally the entire development is most desirable in large developments these sites can be located throughout the development according to established standards for park area distances types of recreation area size range minimum acres per 1000 population a playlot minimum of 8000 square feet not applicable b school park neighborhood playground minimum park of 8 acres 125 c neighborhood park minimum of 5 acres 100 d district wide park minimum of 10 acres 125 e community park minimum of 15 acres 200 _____ total 55 acres of land per 1000 persons 3 required improvements each park site shall be located to front on an improved street at least ten 10 percent of the perimeter of the site shall have lineal contiguity to a public street at least two 2 means of access shall be provided to a park site one shall be by means of a public street any pedestrian access route shall be at least thirty 30 feet wide such pedestrian access may be screened andor landscaped as required by the board of trustees 4 topographical considerations each park site shall have sufficient level grade uninterrupted by streams and drainage ditches as much as possible to permit development for play fields a slope i should not vary greatly in appearance from existing and adjacent slopes ii optimum slopes range from two 2 percent minimum to five 5 percent maximum no less than two 2 percent slope is acceptable under any circumstances iii that onsite drainage patterns be designed and constructed to a insure flow toward swales b insure drainage away from active recreation areas b grading i rough grading shall be completed at time of rough grading of adjacent contiguous areas ii all grading shall comply with village subdivision regulations and approved plans iii finished grades should be uniform in slope between points for which elevations have been established c soils i soils shall not differ from those found occurring naturally ii soils shall not offer any restriction to proposed recreation and leisure utilization iii topsoil will be good friable soil with good tillage and shall be without any admixture of subsoil gravel stones refuse and or other subsurface elements iv topsoil shall not be placed in a muddy or frozen condition v topsoil shall contain no toxic substances which may be harmful to plant growth or human health vi topsoil shall be spread no later than the placement of topsoil on the first lot adjacent to the park site vii a portion of each park site shall have soil to permit the construction of tennis courts park buildings or playgrounds unless otherwise agreed such sites shall have a uniform soil bearing capacity of at least three thousand 3000 psi based on soil boring data provided by the developer d shape i park sites shall be rectangular or nearly rectangular in shape ii nonusable areas and dead spaces shall be minimized e seeding fine grading and seeding shall be completed so that an acceptable stand of grass can be maintained prior to conveyance 5 special requirements for park sites which include storm water detention or retention areas a adequate overflow channels or structures shall be provided meeting all the requirements of the various agencies having jurisdiction over such water improvements b at least sixty 60 feet of space shall be provided between static water lines of ponds and the back or side lots of the adjacent subdivision c there shall be at least a twentyfoot suitable roadway access around the impoundment at high water level wide enough for maintenance and emergency equipment d on all park sites which include storm water detention areas the following regulations will apply i minimum bottom surface area two hundred seventyfive 275 feet square or with one side curved ball diamond or a rectangle two hundred 200 feet wide by three hundred seventyfive 375 feet long footballsoccer field with design of the entire area to be aesthetically pleasing and approved by the appropriate park district and the village ii no more than fifty 50 percent of such park site shall hold water during a year rainfall iii at least fifty 50 percent of the available high ground within such park site shall be of sufficient size and quality to provide adequate recreational facilities playgrounds picnic areas etc unless otherwise agreed iv detention areas shall be so underdrained that there will be no surface water standing on such areas within twentyfour 24 hours after a year rainfall v detention areas within parks shall be graded and seeded and an acceptable stand of maintainable grass established prior to dedication of the area to the appropriate park district vi a lowflow drainage system will be incorporated into the design of the system so that the detention facility holds water only for those rainfalls in excess of a year storm vii detention areas nay not exceed a maximum difference of elevation of four 40 feet between the lowest inlet elevation and the designated overflow point e on all park sites which include water retention the following regulations will apply i no more than fifty 50 percent of such park site shall hold water during a year rainfall ii at least fifty 50 percent of the site must be high ground of sufficient size and quality to provide adequate recreational facilities iii the lake contours must be designed for aesthetic quality and recreational function ie ice skating fishing etc as well as for hydraulic quality iv rip rap shall be provided above and below the static water level to protect the banks and sodded above that point to the high water level to be determined for each condition v each improvement shall be tapered and terraced for safety a central trench of a twelvefoot depth shall be provided covering an area of twentyfive 25 percent of the lake in order to sustain fish life vi retention areas may not exceed a maximum of four 40 feet difference of elevation between normal pool elevation and the designated overflow point vi the developer shall provide necessary engineering calculations indicating that satisfactory aerobic conditions will be maintained if aerobic conditions are unacceptable it shall be the responsibility of the developer to install electrical aerobic devices 6 credit for private open spaces and recreation areas when subdividers provide their own open space for recreation areas and facilities it has the effect of reducing the demand for local public recreational services depending on the size of the subdivision or apartment development a portion of the park and recreational area in subdivisions may at the option of the board of trustees be provided in the form of private open space in lieu of dedicated public open space the extent of same shall be determined by the board of trustees based upon the needs of the projected residents and in conformance to the total park and recreation land for the general area in general a substitution of private open space for dedicated parks will imply a substantially higher degree of improvement and the installation of recreational facilities including equipment by the subdivider as part of his obligation detailed plans of such areas including specifications of facilities to be installed must be approved by the village and before any credit is given for private recreation areas the subdivider must guarantee that these private recreation areas will be permanently maintained for such use by the execution of the appropriate legal documents when an adjustment for private recreation areas is warranted it will be necessary to compute the total park land dedication that would have been required from the subdivision and then subtract the credit to be given b criteria for requiring school site dedication 1 requirements and population ratio the ultimate number of students to be generated by a subdivision shall bear directly upon the amount of land required to be dedicated for school sites or the amount of money to be donated in lieu thereof the land dedication requirement shall be determined by obtaining the ratio of 1 estimated children to be served in each such school classification over the 2 maximum recommended number of students to be served in each such school classification as stated herein and then applying such ratio to the 3 said minimum recommended number of acres for a school site of each such school classification as stated herein the product thereof shall be the acres of land deemed needed to have sufficient land for school sites to serve the estimated increased children in each such school classification 2 school classification and size of school site classifications and size of school sites within the village shall be determined in accordance with the following criteria school classification grades maximum number of students for each such school minimum number of acres of land for each school site for such classifications elementary schools grades kindergarten k5 600 students 11 acres junior high schools grades 6th 68 900 students 19 acres high schools grades 9th 912 2300 students 60 acres 3 location the comprehensive school plan andor the standards adopted by the affected school district shall be used as a guideline in locating sites 4 condition of site and required improvements each proposed school site shall be located to front on one or more public streets at least ten 10 percent of the perimeter of the site shall have lineal contiguity to a public street however in no event shall such required access onto a public street be less than five hundred 500 feet in length the requirements of section 403a4 above regarding site topography and soil shall apply as conditions to the dedication of school sites c criteria for requiring a contribution in lieu of park and school sites where the development is small and the resulting site is too small to be practical or when the available land is inappropriate for park and recreational purposes or a school site the village shall require the subdivider or developer to pay a cash contribution in lieu of the land dedication required the cash contributions in lieu of park and recreation land dedication shall be used solely for the acquisition of park and recreation land as hereinbefore classified which will be available to serve the immediate or future needs of the residents of that subdivision or development or for the improvement of other existing local park and recreation land which already serves such needs the cash contributions in lieu of school sites shall be held in trust by the village or other public body designated by the village solely for use in the acquisition of land for a school site to serve the immediate or future needs of children from that subdivision or for the improvements to any existing school site which already serves such needs if any portion of a cash contribution in lieu of park and recreation land dedication or cash contribution in lieu of school site is not expended for the purposes set forth herein within ten 10 years from the date of receipt the village or other public body designated as trustee above shall refund such contribution to the owners of record of all lots except lots dedicated pursuant to the provisions of this section in the subdivision for which such contribution was made the refund shall be paid to the person who is the owner of record on the day which is the tenth 10th anniversary of the receipt of such contribution the amount of the refund due to each lot owner shall be equal to the amount of the original contribution together with accrued interest thereon divided by the total number of lots in the subdivision excluding only those lots which were dedicated pursuant to this section for which such contribution was made 1 fair market value the cash contributions in lieu of land shall be based on the fair market value exclusive of any sales costs commission and profits of the acres of land in the area improved as specified herein that otherwise would have been dedicated as park and recreation and school sites it has been determined that the present fair market value of such land in and surrounding the village is no less than onehundred seventyfive thousand dollars $175000 per acre and such figure shall be used in making any calculation herein unless the subdivider or developer files a written objection thereto in the event of any such objection the developer shall submit an appraisal showing the fair market value of such improved land in the area of his development or other evidence thereof and final determination of said fair market value per acre of such improved land shall be made by the village based upon such information submitted by the subdivider or developer and from other sources which may be submitted to the village by the park district school district or others 2 criteria for requiring dedication and a fee there will be situations in subdivisions when a combination of land dedication and a contribution in lieu of land are both necessary these occasions will arise when only a portion of the land to be developed is proposed as the location for a park or school site that portion of the land within the subdivision falling within the park or school location shall be dedicated as a site as aforesaid and a cash contribution in lieu thereof shall be required for any additional land that would have to be dedicated  or a major part of the local park or recreation site or school site has already been acquired and only a small portion of land is needed from the development to complete the site the remaining portions shall be required by dedication and a cash contribution in lieu thereof shall be required 3 payment of cash contributions payment of cash contributions shall occur upon the issuance of a building permit d density formula the table of population density is generally indicative of current and short range projected trends in family size for new construction this table or the latest dated revision shall be used in calculating the amount of required dedication of acres of land or the cash contribution in lieu of unless a written objection is filed thereto by the subdivider or developer in the event a subdivider or developer files a written objection to the table of estimated population per dwelling unit listed herein he shall submit his own demographic study showing the estimated additional population to be generated from the subdivision or planned unit development and in that event final determination of the density formula to be used in such calculations shall be made by the board of trustees based upon such demographic information submitted by the subdivider and from other sources which may be submitted to the board of trustees by the park districts school district or others it is recognized that population density age distribution and local conditions change over the years and the specific formula for the dedication of land or the payment of fees in lieu thereof as stated herein is subject to periodic review and amendment if necessary table of estimated or more parcels or building sites each parcel of which is less than five 5 acres in size and not requiring the development andor installation of any new street or easement of access shall be subject to all the provisions of this ordinance except plat requirements b preliminary consultation required prior to the submission of the certified plat of survey required herein the owner or subdivider is encouraged to meet with the planning and zoning commission for the purpose of minimizing the risk of objection to or rejection of the prepared plat of survey and for the purpose of ascertaining the problems and requirements affecting the property c procedure for approval the owner or subdivider shall file with the zoning administrator the original and five 5 contact prints and one reduced print eleven 11 inches by seventeen 17 inches of a certified plat of survey showing the proposed division of such lots blocks parcels or tracts of land copies of the reduced print of the plat of survey shall be forwarded to the planning and zoning commission in accordance with the submittal deadlines established by the community development department not more than fifteen 15 days after the meeting at which the plat of survey is referred to the planning and zoning commission the chairman of the planning and zoning commission shall notify the owner or subdivider whether a new street or easement of access is required in the event that a new street or easement of access is required the notice shall stipulate that an application for final plat approval containing such maps certifications and supporting documents as required by the planning and zoning commission shall be filed with the zoning administrator for processing as herein set forth in this ordinance the planning and zoning commission shall within forty 40 days approve approve conditionally or reject the proposal the board of trustees shall be notified in writing of any conditions of approval or the reasons of rejection if not acted upon within forty 40 days the proposal shall go to the board of trustees for consideration and final resolution d requirements for approval 1 compliance with this ordinance to the extent reasonably practical the division of land shall comply with the provision of this ordinance governing general requirements design standards and required improvements 2 survey the survey shall be performed and the map prepared by a registered illinois land surveyor 3 monuments all corners shall be monumented as follows all lot corners shall be monumented in the field by iron pipes at least twentyfour 24 inches long and one inch in diameter or by round or square iron bars at least twentyfour 24 inches long 4 the lines of lots that extend to rivers or streams shall be monumented in the field by iron pipes at least thirty 30 inches long and one inch in diameter or by round or square iron bars at least thirty 30 inches long these monuments shall be placed at the point of intersection of the river or stream lot line with a meander line established not less than twenty 20 feet back from the bank off the river or stream e certificates and affidavits 1 affidavits required the survey map shall include the affidavit of the surveyor who surveyed and mapped the parcels typed lettered or reproduced legibly with nonfading black ink giving a clear and concise description of the land surveyed by bearings and distances commencing with some corner marked and established in the us public land survey such affidavit shall include the statement of the surveyor to the effect that he has fully complied with the requirement of this section 2 certificates required the certificate of approval of the planning and zoning commission shall be made as provided in exhibit k3 of this ordinance 3 floodplain certification the subdivider shall provide a written certification from a registered land surveyor stating that property to be subdivided is not in a floodplain if a portion of the property is in a floodplain the subdivider must provide a written certification from a registered land surveyor indicating the location and limits of the floodplain f filing of the survey map the village clerk shall retain a copy of the approved survey map and any supporting documents as required by the planning and zoning commission for the village records the village clerk shall have recorded the original of the approved survey map with the recorder of deeds of dupage or cook counties planning and zoning commission guidelines a requirements of the community the planning and zoning commission in the examination of subdivision plans or plats for approval and in the application of this ordinance shall take into consideration the requirements of the community particular attention shall be given to width and location of streets lot sizes and arrangements as well as but not limited to local requirements such as parks and playgrounds schools and recreation sites and other public uses b conformity with comprehensive plan the planning and zoning commission should especially require that all divisions conform to the provisions and conditions of the official comprehensive plan adopted  and as amended from time to time plat approval may be withheld if a subdivision does not conform to the provisions of the comprehensive plan c area plan required where a tract of land proposed for a division is part of a larger logical subdivision unit in relation to the village as a whole the planning and zoning commission may before granting approval request that the subdivider if he owns such tract submit a plan for the entire area or neighborhood to be used by the planning and zoning commission as an aid in judging the proposed plan the village engineer will make available to the subdivider any village information that is available concerning the area for which the plan is to be developed d preservation of natural features in all divisions due regard shall be given to the preservation of natural features such as large trees water courses wetlands wildlife habitats historical sites or structures and similar features  82216 subdivision procedures the preparation of a subdivision for platting may be preceded by an initial investigation and shall go 3 phases preapplication preliminary plat and final plat all in accordance with the procedure as follows preapplication a initial investigation prior to the preparation of a sketch plan and preliminary plat it is suggested that the subdivider meet informally with village personnel to investigate the procedure and standards of the village with reference to this subdivision regulation ordinance and with the proposals of the comprehensive plan as they affect the area in which the proposed subdivision is located at the subdividers request the zoning administrator shall organize and schedule a preapplication conference with appropriate village staff the subdivider is encouraged to meet with the planning and zoning commission to discuss his ideas informally prior to the sketch plan phase b sketch plan 1 applicability any parcel of land larger than four 4 acres in area may be required to receive sketch plan approval prior to the submission of a preliminary plat of subdivision 2 action by the subdivider the subdivider shall submit to the zoning administrator five 5 copies of the sketch plan and all accompanying documentation in accordance with the submittal deadlines established by the community development department the documentation shall include a written notification written notification in the form of a letter of intent from the subdivider to the planning and zoning commission establishing the subdividers intent to develop the land b general subdivision information general subdivision information that shall describe or outline the existing conditions of this site and the proposed development this information shall include data on existing covenants land characteristics and available community facilities and utilities information describing the subdivision proposal shall include the number of residential lots and units broken down by type square footage of buildings and bedroom count  typical lot width and depth  business areas  school playground and park areas  other public areas  street improvements  and soil boring test results c sketch plan a plan prepared on reproducible medium that shall show in simple sketch form the proposed layout of streets lots and other features in relation to existing conditions the sketch plan may be a free hand sketch made directly on a print of the topographic survey the sketch shall include all property owned or controlled by the applicant and those properties adjacent to or considered to be contiguous to the proposed subdivision the sketch plan shall include the existing topographic data and contours of not more than two 2 foot intervals such topographic data for all or part of the plan may be provided at one foot intervals when determined necessary by the village engineer this shall be attached to usgs topographic data the sketch plan should show 1 proposed name of subdivision date and north point  2 location by township range section and parcel number  3 names and addresses of the subdivider and owner  4 names and addresses of the site planner designer engineer or surveyor who prepared the subdivision layout  5 adjacent property or property across an adjacent street along with structures roadways or significant features  6 the location of any floodplain and wetland d tentative engineering proposals tentative engineering proposals regarding water supply sewage disposal stormwater drainage and street improvements c action by the planning and zoning commission upon written report by the zoning administrator and village engineer the planning and zoning commission shall review the general subdivision information and specifically consider the following 1 zoning verification check the existing zoning of the tract and advise the subdivider if a zoning change is necessary or desirable 2 public facility impact determine the adequacy of existing or proposed schools parks and other public spaces in the vicinity of the proposed subdivision with the authorized public bodies involved 3 site inspection inspect the site or otherwise determine its relationship to major streets utility systems and adjacent land uses and determine any unusual problems with regard to topography utilities flooding etc 4 school and park sites advise the developer of the potential acreage allotment or funds in lieu thereof to be donated and utilized for public school and park sites 5 comprehensive plan conformity advise the developer of the comprehensive plan which delineates the land use areas 6 location of floodplains and wetlands advise the developer of the need for a special use hearing if the proposed subdivision is located on a floodplain or wetland area as identified in the village of roselle zoning any us or state official regulatory maps 7 subdivider advised the planning and zoning commission after checking the proposed sketch plan shall advise the subdivider at that time or no later than the next regularly scheduled meeting following the presentation of the sketch plan as to the apparent adequacy of the proposed plan and shall apprise the subdivider of any requirements the village might have that should be incorporated into the design of the subdivision at this stage the subdivider should expect that the planning and zoning commission may require major alterations to be made in the plan if it is found necessary preliminary plat a action by the subdivider the subdivider shall cause to be prepared a preliminary plat said plat shall include all of the property owned or controlled by the applicant and those properties adjacent to or considered to be contiguous to the proposed subdivision together with improvements plans and other supplementary material as specified shall be submitted to the zoning administrator with written application for approval accompanying this preliminary plat and an application for approval shall be five 5 copies of the preliminary plat a reduced eleveninch by seventeeninch print of the plat and all accompanying documentation the required filing fee shall accompany the application these documents are due in accordance with the submittal deadlines established by the community development department b action by the zoning administrator the zoning administrator shall cause copies of the preliminary plat to be distributed to the appropriate village departments the preliminary plat and any comments shall be received by the village of roselle planning and zoning commission not less than five 5 days prior to a regular meeting of the planning and zoning commission c action by the planning and zoning commission the planning and zoning commission zoning administrator and the village engineer shall review the unsubdivided area shall be declared void by the board of trustees in that case the subdivider shall be required to return to the preliminary plat phase of the subdivision process before submitting any final plat of subdivision or as a contingency of signature of the final plat by the village president and village clerk a construction bond is to be posted by the subdivider with the village clerk in the amount of one hundred ten 110 percent of the cost for the completion of the installation of all public improvements to be installed by the subdivider as estimated by the village engineer and as required by these regulations such bond shall be approved by the board of trustees and conditioned upon the installation of required improvements within two 2 years of the approval of the final plat construction bonds submitted on approved village bond forms for required improvements shall be secured to the village by one of the following methods in a form satisfactory to the board of trustees a cash  b certificates of deposit made payable to the village of roselle  c irrevocable letter of credit in a form approved by the village attorney 2 security release the board of trustees shall release construction bonds and any surety thereon with interest if any upon satisfaction of all the following a the subdividers engineer shall furnish two 2 complete sets of as built plans with each set clearly marked as built showing all changes which were necessitated due to field conditions and were approved by the village engineer the cover sheet of as builts shall be signed by the village engineer b certification by the developers engineer and by the village engineer that the improvements have been constructed in substantial compliance with the plans and specifications c satisfaction of the conditions of the bond itself d receipt of a maintenance bond in accordance with subsection 704b 3 partial security release in the event the required improvements are constructed in part upon recommendation of the village engineer the board of trustees may partially release a bond posted under this section  however the security shall not be reduced to less than ten thousand dollars $1000000 or ten 10 percent of the original bond amount whichever is greater b maintenance bonds 1 board of trustees approval required upon acceptance of all required improvements in accordance with section 911 and prior to the release of any construction bond a maintenance bond shall be filed with the village clerk in the amount of fifteen 15 percent of the estimated cost of construction and approved in the same manner as construction bonds guaranteeing repair of defects appearing in the workmanship and materials of said improvements for a period of two 2 years 2 village engineers inspection prior to the expiration date of the maintenance bond but not sooner than eighteen 18 months following acceptance of the bond by the board of trustees the village engineer shall conduct a final inspection of the improvements the village engineer shall notify the developers engineer in advance of the date time and place of the final inspections if such improvements are free of defects the village engineer shall certify in writing that all improvements are free of defects in construction and shall give said certification to the developer and the village clerk in the event there are defects in the construction as determined by the village engineer the village engineer shall give to the developer written notification of those defects and repairs to be made 3 developer response deadline the developer shall within sixty 60 days after receiving written notification from the village engineer cause to be repaired any defects in the construction of the improvements 4 performance failure failure of the developer to complete the repairs within the sixty 60 days of the written notification by the village engineer shall authorize the village to complete the repairs all costs of such repairs shall be paid for by the proceeds of the bond any unused balance shall be refunded to the depositor 5 bond release upon written request by the developer upon certification from the village engineer that all improvements are free of defects in construction and upon satisfaction of the conditions of the bond the board of trustees shall release maintenance bonds and the surety line or substantially so f double frontage lots are not permitted except where such lots back upon a primary street in such instances vehicular and pedestrian access between the lots and the primary street is prohibited double frontage lots shall have an additional depth of at least twenty 20 feet in order to allow for a protective screen planting on one primary street frontage g upon a lake pond water course drainage way channel or stream shall be an additional depth or width as required to provide an acceptable building site h in the subdividing of any land due regard shall be shown for all to interior lots shall be marked as a private easement of access to interior lots with only one permitted entrance to the dedicated street sanitary sewers a no final plat of subdivision shall be approved unless the subdivider provides for and guarantees construction of a sanitary sewer system adequate to serve the needs of the entire development when the same is fully developed the location and design of the sanitary sewer system shall be approved by the village engineer the environmental protection agency of the state of illinois the metropolitan sanitary district in cook county portions of the village and shall comply with the applicable standards and specifications of this section b where sanitary sewerage or potential sanitary sewer serving needs from other areas outside the development necessitates construction of sanitary sewers of a larger size or depth than would be needed by the development itself the board of trustees may consider and determine the terms and conditions thereof with the developer andor adjacent benefitting property owners the enactment of a recapture agreement for purposes of setting forth financing and contractual repayment arrangements for the installation of any additional size or depth of sanitary sewers  such agreements subject to the approval of the board of trustees c sanitary sewer standards 1 the sanitary sewer collection system shall be a gravity flow system and shall be connected to the existing village system by gravity flow if possible sewage lift stations are discouraged and will be approved only where gravity flow connection is not feasible 2 sanitary sewers shall be a minimum of eight 8 inches inside diameter 3 all service connections to sanitary sewers shall be made with wye fittings 4 acceptable materials for sanitary sewers are pvc pipe ductile iron pipe and vitrified clay pipe 5 in general standard specifications for water and sewer main construction in illinois published by the illinois society of professional engineers shall apply 6 manholes shall be provided along all sanitary sewer mains the maximum distance between manholes shall be three hundred fifity 350 feet manholes shall be poured in placed monolithic or precast concrete watertight cast iron frames and lids shall be provided for all manholes storm sewers a no plat of subdivision shall be approved unless the subdivider provides for and guarantees construction of a storm sewer system adequate to serve the needs of the entire development when the same is fully developed b when runoff from areas outside the development necessitates the construction of storm sewers of a larger size or greater depth than would be needed by the development itself the village may consider and determine the terms and conditions thereof with the subdivider andor adjacent benefitting property owners the enactment of a recapture agreement for purposes of setting forth financing and contractual repayment arrangements for the installation of any additional sized or greater depth storm sewers such agreements shall be subject to the approval of the board of trustees c all new streets shall be provided with inlets and underground drainage facilities having a design capacity adequate to carry off surface water falling or draining onto the streets in a minimum of a tenyear return period sufficient inlets shall be provided so that water will not drain across the crown of any street or flow in the gutter for more than six hundred 600 feet measured three hundred 300 feet in any direction the subdividers engineer shall submit calculations showing compliance with these requirements d alternate drainage systems may be approved by the village engineer if a detailed engineering study is performed under the direction of an illinois registered professional engineer which demonstrates that the alternative drainage system provides a level of service at least equal to that provided by the drain requirements without incurring additional maintenance and operating costs to the village e if an existing drainage course in the area of the proposed development abuts an existing enclosed conduit system the subdivider shall extend the existing conduit system in a manner acceptable to the village engineer f storm sewer connections shall be provided for all lots within a subdivision or development g the installation and design of sump pumps shall be so as not to discharge stormwater runoff onto adjoining property or upon any street sidewalk or public way nor shall any sump pump be connected to a sanitary sewer sump pumps shall be installed in accordance with section 694 of the ordinances h storm sewers shall be constructed in accordance with standard specifications for water and sewer main notified to arrange for appropriate inspection private road breakaway gates a any gate installed on any private road within the village shall be of a breakaway design which will not impede emergency vehicles or responders from penetrating the gate by pushing or striking it with an emergency vehicle in any circumstance that the emergency responder is unable to open the gate by other means b no breakaway gate shall be installed within the village unless the village issues a building permit prior to the issuance of a building permit plans shall be submitted to the village building and code department which shall review the plans to determine whether they comply with subsection a of this section c no building permit for a breakaway gate shall be issued unless the owner of the breakaway gate executes a reimbursement and waiver agreement agreeing to reimburse the village or any mutual aid responder for any and all property damage to any emergency vehicles or vehicles responding to emergency calls within the village resulting from the vehicle pushing or striking the breakaway gate to secure entry the reimbursement agreement shall further contain a waiver provision barring the owner of the gate from making any claims against the village or mutual aid emergency responder based upon damages arising from damages to the breakaway gate resulting from an emergency vehicle pushing or striking the breakaway gate the reimbursement and waiver agreement shall be prepared by the village attorney who further shall have the authority to revise the agreement from time to time as the trustees variations and exceptions a hardships where the planning and zoning commission finds that extraordinary hardships or particular difficulties regarding the physical development of land may result from strict compliance with these regulations it may recommend variations or exceptions to these regulations so that substantial justice may be done and the public interest secured provided that such variation or exception shall not have the effect of nullifying the intent and purpose of this ordinance  and further provided the planning and zoning commission shall not recommend variations or exception to the regulations of this ordinance unless it shall make findings based upon the evidence presented to it in each specific case that 1 public welfare protected the granting of the variation will not be detrimental to the public safety health or welfare or injurious to other property or improvements in the neighborhood in which the property is located  2 unique conditions the conditions upon which the request for a variation is based are unique to the property for which the variation is sought and are not applicable generally to other property  and 3 particular physical conditions because of the particular physical surroundings shape or topographical conditions of the specific property involved a particular hardship to the owner would result as distinguished from a mere inconvenience if the strict letter of the regulations were carried out 4 technological design and materials advances that products techniques methods or materials commonly accepted in subdivision improvements are not recognized by the standards of this b conditions in recommending variations and exceptions the planning and zoning commission may require such conditions as will in its judgment secure substantially the objectives of the standards or requirements of this ordinance c procedure a petition for any such variance shall be submitted to the zoning administrator at the ordinance article 1  authority and purpose statutory authority 1 this ordinance shall be known and may be cited as the village of roselle illicit discharge detection and elimination the village of roselle dupage county illinois promulgates this ordinance pursuant to 65 ilcs 5121 5111212 11302 11308 and 511312 and such other authority as applicable to those communities this ordinance is adopted in accordance with in accordance with dupage county stormwater management plan the plan  purposes of this ordinance 1 the purpose of this ordinance is to ensure the health safety and general welfare of the citizens of roselle and protect and enhance water quality in a manner pursuant to and consistent with the federal water pollution control act 33 usc  1251 et seq regulation of nonstormwater discharges to the storm drainage system this ordinance establishes methods for controlling the introduction of discharges other than those occurring as a direct result of precipitation and or snow melt into the municipal separate storm sewer system ms4 and the storm drainage system in order to comply with requirements of the national pollutant discharge elimination system npdes phase ii permit process other purposes of this ordinance include a to regulate the contribution of pollutants to the ms4 and the storm drainage system by nonstormwater discharges  and b to prohibit illicit connections and discharges to the ms4 and the storm drainage system 2 the purposes of this ordinance are consistent with the plan and advance the following objectives of the plan a protect and enhance the quality quantity and availability of surface and groundwater resources b preserve and enhance existing aquatic and riparian environments and encourage restoration of degraded areas c promote equitable acceptable and legal measures for stormwater management 3 the purposes of this ordinance shall be implemented by its provisions  secs 310  reserved article 2  definitions interpretation of terms and words for the purposes of this ordinance the terms and words used herein shall be interpreted as follows 1 words used in the present tense include the future tense  and 2 words used in the singular number include the plural number and words used in the plural number include the singular number  and 3 the words shall will and must are mandatory not permissive  and 4 the phrase director refers to the individual responsible for the enforcement  definitions for the purposes of this ordinance the following words and terms shall have the meanings set forth except where otherwise specifically indicated words and terms not defined shall have the meanings indicated by common dictionary definition building a structure that is constructed or erected partially or wholly above ground and is enclosed by walls and a roof the term building includes manufactured homes and includes both the aboveground and the belowground portions of the structure clean water act cwa the federal water pollution control act 33 usc  1251 et seq and any subsequent amendments thereto committee the stormwater management committee of the dupage county board authorized by 55 ilcs 551062 community any municipality or the unincorporated county within dupage county acting as a unit of local government county the county of dupage illinois department the village of roselle department of public that is built installed or established to serve a particular purpose hazardous materials any material which may cause or significantly contribute to a substantial hazard to human health safety property or the environment illicit connections an illicit connection is defined as either of the following 1 any drain or conveyance whether on the surface or subsurface that allows an illicit discharge to enter the storm drainage system including but not limited to any conveyances that allow any nonstormwater discharge including sewage process wastewater and wash water to enter the storm drainage system and any connections to the storm drainage system from indoor drains and sinks regardless of whether said drain or connection had been previously allowed permitted or approved by the community or 2 any drain or conveyance connected from a commercial or industrial land use to the storm drainage system that has not been documented in plans maps or equivalent records and approved by the community illicit discharge any direct or indirect nonstormwater discharge to the storm drainage system except as exempted in of this ordinance industrial activity activities subject to an industrial npdes stormwater permit as defined in 40 cfr b14 line a hollow conduit fluids are transported between two or more points municipal separate storm sewer system ms4 a conveyance or system of governmental entity and designed or used for collecting or conveying stormwater and that is not used for collecting or conveying sewage national pollutant discharge elimination system npdes permit a
